content: up and knit 18 18 18 18 21 21 24 24 24 sts from the right shoulder of the back piece you should be picking up from the corner to the stitch marker row 1 ws p2 turn row 2 rs make a ds k to end turn row 3 p to previous ds p2tog p3 turn row 4 make a ds k to end turn repeat the last two row 4 4 4 4 5 5 6 6 6 more times next row p to previous ds p2tog p1 turn next row k to end turn next row p to end turn wan cheng phua © copyright 2024 knittygrittysg com moving on to neckline increases row 1 rs k to 1 st before end m1r k1 turn row 2 ws p to end turn repeat these two row 4 4 5 5 5 5 5 5 5 more times you should have 23 23 24 24 27 27 30 30 30 sts do not break yarn continue with joining the front neckline joining the front neckline knit across front right shoulder stitches using the working yarn cast on 25 28 29 31 28 31 28 30 33 sts cable cast on is suggested for structural strength knit across front left shoulder stitches you should have 71 74 77 79 82 85 88 90 93 sts continue by working 3 3 1 1 1 3 3 5 5 row of stockinette flat starting with a ws row do not break yarn continue with joining in the round wan cheng phua © copyright 2024 knittygrittysg com joining in the round while picking up shoulder stitches next the front and back pieces are joined while picking up stitches at the sides of the shoulders for sleeve caps your working yarn is at point a you will knit from point a to b pick up stitches from b to c knit from c to d pick up stitches from d to a and then join in the round b a front piece back piece c d k across front piece a to b until 1 st remaining place stitch marker k1 along b to c pick up and knit 24 24 24 24 24 26 26 30 30 sts the pick up rate is about 2 sts for every 3 row along the side edge k1 from held stitches of back piece place stitch marker k across back piece c to d until 1 st remaining place stitch marker k1 along d to a pick up and knit 24 24 24 24 24 26 26 30 30 sts join in the round and k1 from front piece place beginning of round marker you should have 190 196 202 206 212 222 228 240 246 sts for clarity you are essentially borrowing one stitch from the edge of the front and back pieces for the sleeves this is important for the set-in sleeve seam to look clean wan cheng phua © copyright 2024 knittygrittysg
